website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a simple leash, it's one to consider – but it's not practical for more active dogs.
pros: A simple yet sturdy dog leash at a value price
Made of polypropylene material that resists mold, mildew, and water absorption
It's available in several fun colors
cons: The handle padding is a bit thin, and the clasp seems less able to handle large, active dogs than others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I will preface this by saying Amazon's policy gets five stars... They refunded my money because of the issues I had with the leash and for that I think they write a five star review. The leash itself is garbage. After 30 days of light use (once per day) The leash has come apart at the handle and the stitching is fraying up and down the entire length of the leash. At this point it is unusable...I would not recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wade

customer_reviews.title: Nice leash for the money
customer_reviews.text: Leash is attractive. The strap feels sturdy. If you're comparing to the best, the spring hook could be a bit more robust - the spring force is not quite as strong as I would like. If it stays the way it is, it will be fine; if it weakens at all, then I would have concerns that the hook may have the opportunity to separate from the dog's collar. I compared it to the leash that was given to me by the rescue when they dropped the pooch off to me. Sure enough the hook was stronger and the spring force greater. But for now is fine, and a good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: TLTommy

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made and quite reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made and quite reasonably priced. A very good product. There is a smooth, leather-like lining in the loop of the handle, which makes the loop a little stiff and might take some getting used to. It's a bit of an unnecessary detail as far as I'm concerned, but it might be appreciated by some and does make the handle feel quite stout. Overall, a very nice dog leash.
customer_reviews.author: Ruge

customer_reviews.title: Holding up 1.5 years later. Good value so far
customer_reviews.text: I got this leash a year and a half ago for my lab pup (she's 70lbs now). This thing has seen some rough days, lots of pulling, the washer, the inside of her mouth, and her teeth and it is still holding together. Slight fraying on one small part where she tried to chew it. The only part that is coming apart is the padding on the handle. It hasn't torn off completely, but has cracked and split. Not a big issue, I only notice when I tie a poop bag to the handle and try to slide it along the inside of the handle and it catches on a crack. Great value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Antsy

customer_reviews.title: Clasp opens on own
customer_reviews.text: Three times the silver claap of the leash just opened on its own. The first two times I thought were just flukes and it happened in the house so I didn't think anything of it. The third time we were in the park, my dog hadn't been pulling or anything. She's a 12 pound jack russell. The leash clasp opened on its own and I had to chase my dog 3 blocks as she ran in-between cars and over a main road. I live in a major city. Will not be using this product and I do not recommend anyone buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: High-quality leash
customer_reviews.text: I have a 7.5 lb. chocolate toy poodle named Mocha, and I have found that four-feet leashes are the most effective length to give me good control easily, even when Mocha wants to pull or take off after something. such as a squirrel :). I ordered a red 4-foot leash from Downtown Pet Supply, and I was/am extremely impressed by how quickly I received my order and by the quality of the leash, the brightness of its color, and the nice padded handle for the owner/walker to hold. I will definitely order more products from Downtown Pet Supply.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa A. Cox

customer_reviews.title: A Very Satisfied Customer
customer_reviews.text: I have just received my new leash--it is exceptionally nice. It replaces the first version of the same leash that I started using in June, when my puppy arrived. Leash #1 has received daily use, and I am replacing it only because it is kind of dirty and "tired" looking. Otherwise it is in perfect condition, with no fraying or other signs of wear. The hardware is sturdy and the handle is really nice--it has a kind of cushion on the inside and is very comfortable to hold. I give it the, obviously, highest endorsement: I have made a repeat purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KPM

customer_reviews.title: Great for small to medium dogs that do not pull
customer_reviews.text: This leash is exactly what I was looking for. The padded handle is a little on the smaller side but my hand fits I am just use to a larger opening. This leash is good for small to medium dogs that do not pull. I wouldn't recommend it for large, strong dogs or dogs that continuously pull for the duration of the walk. Color, length and quality as described. The clasp does swivel.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity17

customer_reviews.title: This leash is the perfect length for training
customer_reviews.text: This leash is the perfect length for training. With a longer leash, our dog kept wrapping himself around this handler, nearly causing injury. That is near impossible with this leash. The short length also gives better control when near traffic or distractions that he would otherwise be tempted to run towards. We are training our dog to be a service dog so full control when is imperative and this leash provides that control.
customer_reviews.author: Merilla Miller

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd 4ft length order. The quality seems to be the same as our first except the clasp does not seemed to be as smooth as the one we got from our first order. We have just order a 6ft leash for our puppy's obedience training, will review and compare the quality of the clasp when we get it. Overall this is a light leash which we really like, it is comfortable and we do not want to feel like we need a heavy leash to communicate with our dog. A light tug is all we need.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t like at all!
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed with product. I wanted a plain RED leash and this is some kind of a fustian red. Terrible color. Will order another from another source. There is Stan dard shade of red used for dog harnesses, leashes and all. Why did you have to create your own shade that sure isn’t jus RED?
customer_reviews.author: CLWilson

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: This leash is perfect for my puppy. She hasn't chewed it yet, but we will have to watch and see if she does. We got a different leash before that was an inch thick and it weighed her down. But this leash was a 6ft long 1/2 inch wide purple leash and this didn't weigh her down at all. It is perfect! I will definitely be purchasing another one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love this leash
customer_reviews.text: Love this leash, use it (combined with a collar and not a harness) to secure my small dog to the metal bar on the car seat headrest. It's short enough for him to stay on the seat and long enough for him to lay down and rest as well. This is my experience with my dog, don't follow advice on the internet and do your own research! PROS: High-quality materials Perfect length for my needs CONS: NONE!
customer_reviews.author: Jake R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect length! Great quality. Poor latch.
customer_reviews.text: I had a shorter one I used for my Doberman. It was barely long enough for my Westie/Bichon mix. This 2' leash gives him just enough room without having too much range. I use it when I take him to the vet, etc. The construction is overkill for my little pup. It's super thick. The padded handle is very comfortable is you have a tugger. I do not like the snap hook. This type can work open very easily. I would give it five stars if it had a carabiner style latch.
customer_reviews.author: Lily R

customer_reviews.title: Thin, but strong
customer_reviews.text: I needed a four foot purple leash for a patient therapy program my dog participates in. It was hard to find, but Downtown Pet had a lot of choices. It was not expensive and arrived quickly. The clasp is sturdy, the webbing is 3/4” wide and quite thin, but it’s well made and should hold up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Face

customer_reviews.title: Not at all as expected but useable
customer_reviews.text: Okay leash, really nice grip for my hand, but the rest of the leash was a disappointment. If the lower part of leash was as thick and we'll made as the handle, I would be a happy camper! As is I am not confident using it. The clip that attaches to collar is too small, again not in keeping with the quality of the handle. Arthritic hands, beware!
customer_reviews.author: Littlduck15

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: These 2 foot leads are the best for training purposes, also if you have a dog that gets very excited when the door bell rings they are great to have by the door. I have every color you offer. They are hard to find at any pet store, independent or big box. The price is wonderful and if you had more colors I would buy more! Good and sturdy, I have four large dogs and the leads handle them very well, nice when you don't want or need a 4 or 6 foot leash.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: This was better than I expected. The inside of the loop that fits on your hand is padded, which I didn't expect, and is very comfortable. I have a small dog, so it's not that big a deal, but that feature would be great when walking a larger dog that can really tug.
customer_reviews.author: Vic Spadaccini

customer_reviews.title: Tear Easily
customer_reviews.text: I had initially given this 5 stars. First two I bought lasted a couple years then both split right in the middle of the leash during a casual stroll. I thought they were just worn out. I bought two new ones in June of 2017. Used maybe 5 or 6 walks to now beginning of August and once again during a causal walk with a smaller sized dog the leash split in the middle with another about ready to split. Very odd place to split. Not happy anymore with these leashes. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Great value for a back-up leash
customer_reviews.text: I got the 2' lead. Good leash for the money. It has a nice semi-padded handle. The hardware is okay. It feels good enough but I prefer leashes with a really heavy duty snap. I do not use this leash for regular walks, just when we go to the vet, pet store, or a crowded place and I want to keep my dog close by as well as a general backup leash. If I was planning on using this as my regular leash I would have splurged and got something leather or with a heavier snap for my GSD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I had gone back to a previous order to get order another couple leashes from a few years back and instead of what I ordered before I was sent these leashes instead. These are junk! The leash is nothing like the one I have and falling apart! Only two weeks in and one of them has a flaw that is about to break apart. Glad I noticed before I lost my dog! Don't bother buying these it's a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Allen

customer_reviews.title: Big Clip!
customer_reviews.text: I like shorter leashes when walking my dog and they’re almost impossible to find at dog stores...most are 6:feet. The harness I have has thick clips and none of the leashes worked out except this one.
customer_reviews.author: TrishB

customer_reviews.title: As expected- nothing special
customer_reviews.text: It's as expected for the price- cheap materials and pretty basic. The leash is made of nylon webbing, and the handle has a thin layer of a plastic/foam padding. It's too short for my needs, but not worth returning because the fee is almost as much as the leash cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: The extra stiff padded handle is awkward, it flings around when I am maneuvering my dog (and not holding on the the padded loop). If all your going to do - is walk them always holding the loop - then ok. also I love the pink color - but it sure does not stay pink:) get a darker color... Oh - and the loops stitching came of a few months after I bought it. I sewed it back on my machine....
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable grip
customer_reviews.text: Loved the leash. Shame my Pomeranian chewed through it on the first walk. My dog is notorious for killing leashes. Still a good leach and a very comfortable grip.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product.
customer_reviews.text: Since I walk my Lab off-leash most of the time, I wanted something small and light for those instances when I want her close and secure. This leash is fully adequate for that purpose. It's certainly strong enough and even has a heavy-duty clip which almost seems like too much for the purpose. It's a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Nightrunner

customer_reviews.title: If they pull, don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend if your dog pulls even slightly, to not buy this leash! I have a 12lb miniature pinscher, he pulls but doesn't drag me, and this damn leash has detached more than a few times. This morning he got lose on our walk, my biggest fear is him being run over or another dog attacking him. He's a runner, I'm so lucky he stopped so I could catch him. Please buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly B.

customer_reviews.title: Leashes don't last
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these leashes September 2017. My dogs are good walkers and don't pull so the leashes don't have too much strain on them. The stitching came out where the handle is folded over to meet the lead. The only reason I gave them 1 star was because it is hard to find 4 foot leashes and these were nice and short. The handles were padded nicely as well but a leash should last more than 16 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sherilyn Sonenshine

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality leash I’ve ever had but it gets the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality leash I’ve ever had but it gets the job done. I bought it because I thought it was a good price for the length. It’s a good backup leash which is what I originally bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: Cristal Benton

customer_reviews.title: Well made.
customer_reviews.text: The lead is perfect for holding my dog close to me. The handle is very comfortable. I am also able to click this onto a longer lead if I want for when we our taking long walks in the parks. The lock that attaches to a harness or collar is well made. I am very impressed. The Blueberry sweater that arrived with the lead, fit perfectly in the #12. The next size up was huge even though it said 14 inches. The shipping was speedy as well.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn L.

customer_reviews.title: I have 5 dogs and these were perfect. All my dogs are small but these are ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 dogs and these were perfect. All my dogs are small but these are light enough. I used these with the 3 in 1 leash to configure my dog leash needs to my dogs own walking style. 2 like to stay so close when walking that I can feel them brushing against me as we walk. 3 like to get out front.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Simons

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and design.
customer_reviews.text: Rhis is exactly what I was looking for. All the other short leads I had found were the thicker 1inch width and only 18inches, for my 34lb dog that was just to big and not long enough but a 4 ft lead was to long. I was pleasantly surprised at the perfect weight, length, and quality of this leash. For being smaller than a normal traffic lead it does not feel flimsy at all and the handle is nicely padded without being to bulky. It is working perfectly for me and my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Leash for My Small Dog
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice leash. I have a small dog but I think it would work just as well for a big dog, however, it is only 6'. My dog likes to chew on his leashes when I stop to talk to someone, so I usually have to buy at least one new one per year. I'm pretty sure he'll be able to chew through this one too and I'll just replace it next year.
customer_reviews.author: Volunteer

customer_reviews.title: Great construction
customer_reviews.text: The grip is fantastic - sturdy faux-leather liner to the nylon grip that sits nicely around my wrist. The length (4ft) is perfect for my 11lb chiweenie; she can walk ahead of me a bit but not so much that it takes tremendous effort to get her next to me and away from others. Sturdy construction - I would even use this with my guide dog!
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Much better control of the pup
customer_reviews.text: I love this leash. Having the dog only two feet away limits his meandering in front or behind me. I do not have to switch hands all the time, which gets annoying after a while. The leash still gives the pup enough space to do his business or to sniff the ground, but it gives me the ultimate control. I highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: NOVAGirl

customer_reviews.title: an added plus is the handle is padded and very comfortable and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: 2 foot strong durable dog leash is just what I was looking for. I have a new puppy and she is already really big and tall. I was looking for a short leash that was strong and durable. an added plus is the handle is padded and very comfortable and easy to hold. I wanted a short leash to keep her clos to learn more of a heal. the 2 foot leash is working for us.
customer_reviews.author: zzimmee

customer_reviews.title: it seems quite strong and the clip that you put on the collar is a good heavy duty one
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the six-foot leash in purple the shipping was prompt, the leash is as advertised. I've used it once for a walk, it seems quite strong and the clip that you put on the collar is a good heavy duty one. I would buy this again and will recommend this to others
customer_reviews.author: Judy jaye

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice leash, well made- especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice leash, well made- especially for the price, but I gave only 4 stars because I don't like the handle. It's got some kind of plastic/leathery reinforcement on the inside lining of the handle which makes it a bit uncomfortable to hold. Plus, I have 3 dogs with 3 separate leashes to hold on to. It's just too much of a handful for me. Perhaps I have small hands...
customer_reviews.author: HaJoCo

customer_reviews.title: Great Leashes
customer_reviews.text: Bought (2 ) 4 foot leashes for my yorkies (10 lbs and 6lbs). I bought these leashes because I want to start hiking with my dogs. I needed something that was long enough for them to be able explore but short enough to where they would be close to me in case something pops out of the woods. These leashes are super comfortable to hold on too compared to my plastic retractable handles I previously had. They seem really sturdy and hopefully will last a long time. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Face

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable quality leash at a reasonable price - don't like handle
customer_reviews.text: The leash itself is functional, clip appears sufficiently sturdy, but the "padding" where the "hooman" holds on to the leash is of a material that does not feel good against the skin - especially in a warmer climate. That is a personal preference so I did not return it. If I had the opportunity to handle this leash at a local pet store, I would NOT have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: TexasJohnnyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Small, uncomfortable hand loop
customer_reviews.text: Buyer needs to be aware that the hand loop is 1.3/8" smaller than normal for a 6' lead. I don't have a big hand or wrist but the difference is quite noticeable. Additionally the loop interior has a "spongy" substance that is, for me, uncomfortable. The lead hook appears okay but after onealk aroundblock it show a bit of wear. I will be giving this away as soon as I get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: LadiHwk

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and sturdy. I've had this long enough now to add: This is holding up wonderfully through puppy phase. This is the lead I bought to use with puppy training and it is holding up to chewing, pulling, and everything else my puppy throws at it. He weighs about 18 lbs now and pulls hard, but I'm not worried about this lead holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Z.

customer_reviews.title: Durable Leash
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as expected. I will say this is slightly too large/heavy for our new puppy so we will be getting a training lead. But, we tied knots into the leash to shorten it to make it work until he grows into it. I like the lining on the inside of the handle loop too.
customer_reviews.author: lizr79

customer_reviews.title: But I do love it all in all
customer_reviews.text: It feels very cheaply made. But I do love it all in all. I feel like the handle will age badly and flake. The material is weird. Like a faux leather ??? The clip sometimes acts like it doesn't want to open and close easy. I'll be using it for light walks and it'll still be my go to leash but I'll likely look for something better later.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: A nice padded handle for comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I like the padded handle. The previous leash handle would start to cut into me if the dog pulled. I could probably use a lease about a foot shorter as I am always gathering it to avoid tripping when the dog slows up or stops.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Within 4 weeks of owning this leash, the stitching in the handle started to tear out. Now the vinyl padding is tearing. I'm going back to my 6 year old leash!
customer_reviews.author: Soundman Art

customer_reviews.title: Trust me....this isn't the one you want
customer_reviews.text: Neither strong nor durable. Puppy destroyed it with just very minimal grabbing it in her mouth while on walks. It is single-ply and very thin. I have another leash that i have owned for 20 years and through 3 puppies...this other leash shows no sign of damage from the same treatment that completely destroyed this one.
customer_reviews.author: I am the man

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and durable leashes
customer_reviews.text: These are great leashes. We have two 50 lb dogs and are training them. We were using 4 ft leashes and you have to wrap all that excess around your wrists, so we opted to give this a try and they work just great! They're very sturdy and durable and much easier to manage than the 4-6 ft leashes. We've looked and looked for the 2 ft size and only found them on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mrsjmac

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for small/mediium dogs
customer_reviews.text: An excellent leash! The hand strap area has an inner core of synthetic leather sewn in so that it doesn't won't collapse to a flat strap that could easily pull through your fingers should you encounter another animal during the walk. It makes it very comfortable to hold. Additionally, the clasp is not over-sized. Many leashes 1/2 inch wide have a clasp that looks like it belongs on a horse lead instead of a dog leash.
customer_reviews.author: KenO

customer_reviews.title: grip is stiff and rubbery
customer_reviews.text: The leash is fine and I will be keeping it as a spare but I don't really like the rubbery stiff feel of the hand held grip. Would rather have just plain webbing around my hand/wrist it is softer and more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Holiday

customer_reviews.title: Good if your dog isn't a puller
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase of this leash. I like to keep a short leash on one of my 40 lb. dogs because she's all over the place and likes to chase after squirrels. It worked well until it didn't and after 6 months of use, the seam at the handle ripped apart.
customer_reviews.author: Meryl V.

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a good, sturdy and short leash to help train a ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a good, sturdy and short leash to help train a 6 month old shelter pup who recently adopted us. The leash allowed me to work with him to under stand where I want him be positioned during our walks. As the product info states, the handle has a softer, non-slip rubberized lining which works very well for either holding in your hand or slipping over your wrist. Good reliable product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle White

customer_reviews.title: Thin leash
customer_reviews.text: For a "Strong Durable" leash it sure is thin. The good thing is that it is cheap. I don't recommend this for bigger dogs or dogs that pull. I used this to walk a foster dog that pulled when she saw squirrels and it was uncomfortable. I went to the pet store for a stronger and thicker leash instead.
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Strong, good stitching.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality and a reasonable price. I didn't even notice the leather inside the handle loop, nice touch! This "Strong Durable Dog Leash Lead - Black 6' Foot" will get a workout hiking with my American Bulldogs :). Only Con I noticed is the spring in the clasp feels kind of gritty/cheap, but it's nice thick metal and I don't foresee it failing for any reason anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan M.

customer_reviews.title: Good lead
customer_reviews.text: The lead is nice. Thick and strong with a nice handle. The problem I had with it was the cheesy tag they glued and sewed on the leash, crooked and uneven. I'm all about giving credit to a company and I will proudly sport any brand/store that has reliable products. But that tag cheapened the lead so I removed it.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted Amazon Mom

customer_reviews.title: This is the second leash I've bought because I love the purple color so much
customer_reviews.text: I have a large 60 pound lab/pit mix. This is the second leash I've bought because I love the purple color so much. The first one the handle broke from my dog pulling after having it for 6 months or so.
customer_reviews.author: Karlie

customer_reviews.title: Replaced some well used leashes
customer_reviews.text: These were much sturdier and cheaper than the ones I had previously.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood8

customer_reviews.title: It's very sturdy and easy to hold.
customer_reviews.text: It's sturdy and easy to use on my Golden Retriever. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Pribnow

customer_reviews.title: Tore apart in less than 10 months of use
customer_reviews.text: The handle is tearing apart after 10 months of use with my beagle, who does pull at the leash. So, I have to replace it, which is a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Deb Dz

customer_reviews.title: Don't last very long - hardware breaks.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this leash (3/4" by 6" leash) 4 months ago, for a puppy that currently weighs 38 lbs. Today the clip on the end of the leash broke. This is NOT a "heavy duty, big dog" training leash.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Julander

customer_reviews.title: Perfect leash
customer_reviews.text: I love this leash because it is light, while being strong. IMy pup is ready for a longer leash now as she is 6 months old, loves to walk with my other dog and get in “front”. Great buy and perfect color.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find size.
customer_reviews.text: I walk two dogs at once and use something that attaches to both dogs. I need a short leash for it. This one worked perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amz Shopper

customer_reviews.title: What I like most
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product so much so I bought it again. It is durable and easy to grip. When my dog pulls I still have a good grip on her.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Tyson

customer_reviews.title: It seams better mad and not flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Well made and strong. The metal attachment is strong. I have had leashes with cheap clips that came open when the dog pulled. This one is more strong and secure. It seams better mad and not flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina G

customer_reviews.title: Ehh, thin material feels very cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Thin and very cheap feeling. Don't trust it with my 90 lb dog who doesn't even pull.
customer_reviews.author: MJRWey

customer_reviews.title: This leash is nice we have a large dog and it works for ...
customer_reviews.text: This leash is nice we have a large dog and it works for him. The leather around the handle is nice I wish it went the whole length of the leash but then it wouldn't be so inexpensive. It is a good length and the dog seems to like it too.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, strong, and comfortable!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE this leash. The padded handle is wonderful and is much more comfortable than any other leash I have used. The length, 6 feet, is great for letting my dog sniff around, but still not go too far away from me. I have used it for about two months now and couldn't be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis F.

customer_reviews.title: Not for big sized breeds, checkout the pics for double and single thickness leashes
customer_reviews.text: I have a rottweiler and I couldn't trust the strength of the leash. It's okay for small to medium size dogs but not for the larger sized breeds. I recommend getting a double thickness leash, this one is a single. In the picture added, the top leash is a double thickness leash that I got at pet-smart for $10 and the bottom leash is from downtown that I got for $8 on amazon prime day, check out the difference. For 2 bucks more you get double the strength.
customer_reviews.author: Wasgad

customer_reviews.title: Great for training
customer_reviews.text: Solid, well sewn, really good price. We have a poodle mix and a staffordshire terrier mix and these work great for both dogs as training leads in places where you just want a short handle to grasp.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Y

customer_reviews.title: Not a quality leash!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this leash to walk a 50 lb. dog. Had it a month and a half and the stitching is ripping. I would not recommend this product. I had a leash I used for 3 other dogs, it lasted over 35 years and this one only a month and a half! This product should not be sold!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Gossard

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I love this leash, especially the handle...which is padded on the inside with a leather like material which is easy on the hand and makes handling the leash soooooooooooo much letter. The leash is awesome and really makes the pet stores leashes look pretty sad.
customer_reviews.author: Turrie Bath

customer_reviews.title: Great leash for more control.
customer_reviews.text: Great leash! I bought a 2 ft for my 35lb dog who sometimes pulls a bit too hard. With this leash, I can easily hold him closer to me and have more control. I liked it so much I bought a second one for my slightly smaller dog. Great control! The only down side to this leash: I have to slow my walk down and walk in the grass when I want them to do their business. It isn't a problem - you just have to be aware of your dogs needs and signals and allow them the opportunity when they need it.
customer_reviews.author: JFB

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping my little dog where he needs to be in a car!
customer_reviews.text: I have a couple of these. I use them to keep my little dog in his own seat whenever I travel with him. It is long enough he can look out the window and short enough that he cannot get into my lap when I am driving. A little pricey, but I needed another one.
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to hold & just the right length.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this same leash in black for my dog a while back. I loved this leash so much that when we got a 2nd pup I bought a second in pink. Love the shorter length and the leather inside the hand loop. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Doreen KtoZ

customer_reviews.title: They look nicer in the picture
customer_reviews.text: I don't care for this leash. They are inexpensive so I wasn't expecting luxury but they do have a cheap feel to them. The handle is too small and rigid for me. I like to have a leash on my wrist and hold below the handle with my hand. The rigidity of the padding makes in uncomfortable to do this.
customer_reviews.author: NCHTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Padded handle
customer_reviews.text: Wow, why didn't I buy this one first. The 4' is great for me because I am so short and other leashes can drag when we walk. However, this has a padded handle for you that blew my mind! I love mine, in purple 💜
customer_reviews.author: Pure Prarie

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this for a small dog and it is ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a small dog and it is a little "sturdy" for her, but it is well made and would work well for a medium to large dog.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Jordan

customer_reviews.title: A bit on the flimsy side
customer_reviews.text: This leash is flimsier than other leashes I have used. It does what it’s supposed to do but the overall quality does not rate 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph E. Stephan

customer_reviews.title: Quality Lead!
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these leashes for my Labrador Retriever who loves to pull. It's sturdy enough to hold her, but since it's so short, she doesn't pull anymore and just stays right by my side. It's been a great training leash, and the greatest part about it? Even when I go back to the longer leash (6',) she still doesn't pull! Glad to have someone make quality 2' leads!
customer_reviews.author: JewelRuby

customer_reviews.title: These leashes were requested and donated to a animal shelter ...
customer_reviews.text: These leashes were requested and donated to a animal shelter. The shelter not only uses the leashes but they are given to the families who adopt a dog allowing families to know the proper length and width needed for their dog. I donated them in the color red as the cost was less. I would purchase again. The deliver was reasonably fast.
customer_reviews.author: Floweringplum

customer_reviews.title: Puppy has a brand new leash
customer_reviews.text: well made, sturdy, right length, and red. A slight wider than I'm used to, but it's not a problem. As long as it is reliable to keep puppy safe, i'm happy. Just hope he likes red.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie Em

customer_reviews.title: Good, short leash
customer_reviews.text: Good, short leash. Very useful in combination with another very short leash. With two very short leashes attached, I can use it to walk bioth my dogs at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Anne V WIlliams

customer_reviews.title: Nope
customer_reviews.text: Latch is defective and product showed as not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: It is well made and fits fine in the kids' hands but I like a leash ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight leash that we take on trips because it doesn't take up much space. However, it sin't our 'go to' leash. It is well made and fits fine in the kids' hands but I like a leash that has more substance for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Medenwaldt

customer_reviews.title: I bought two, well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these leashes! They are much softer than all other leashes I've had in the past but still durable. My 60 lb pit bull tends to bite through leashes but these have lasted. Also, the best part is that the handle is padded to avoid discomfort. I will definitely buy more of these leashes in the future if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, highly recommened
customer_reviews.text: I love the length of this leash, I can comfortably walk her beside me when riding my scooter and when I have her out in public pushing a cart without a lot of excess leash to hold onto and get caught in the wheels. I use it daily.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: best training leash!
customer_reviews.text: I have a new Labrador, 5 mos strong! Had to wrap 4ft leash till hand was purple. This 2ft is perfect for pullers because I will not use choke collar, I use with walk in step harness. He's bigger that normal around 40lbs already. I hate choke collars so, this is best option for me and it works!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Berry

customer_reviews.title: Nice leash except for the handle
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great leash except for the handle. The leash is soft, narrow and lightweight until you get to the handle. For some reason, they stitched stiff, heavy vinyl into the handle which makes it uncomfortable to hold and unable to be rolled up and put in your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these leashes
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these leashes, they are a great length for everyday dog walking and strong. I've got 2 for my dog and recently bought more for my parents to use with theirs.The handle of my first leash broke at the stitching when my 120lb dog lunged against it but for the money these leashes are every bit of quality you'd need for day-to-day.
customer_reviews.author: Sean R McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not good. leash seemed to be made out hair ribbon material. I would not buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Wire

customer_reviews.title: Great leash
customer_reviews.text: I have used this twice since I got it four days ago. It is exactly as advertised, I would say even a little brighter than pictured!
customer_reviews.author: J.Wash

customer_reviews.title: Nice Padded Handle
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised to find that the handle is padded. Personally, I would have preferred it be heavier for the width of the leash, but hubby loves everything about it. We have quite a few leashes and this is his favorite.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Best leash
customer_reviews.text: I think I have bought 6 of these. They are very durable with a nice handle to hold. We have them at all doors going out for convenience.
customer_reviews.author: Rodeo Girl

customer_reviews.title: The leashes were of good quality and sturdy but the backing in the handle ...
customer_reviews.text: The leashes were of good quality and sturdy but the backing in the handle made it too stiff for my purposes. I have 2 Chis (5-6 lbs) and I like to knot the leash around my wrist so it doesn't slip out of my hand. That is the only reason I returned them.
customer_reviews.author: elvisfan12

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for dog and owner!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect legnth to walk my dachshund. No more wrapping the leash around my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Megsdustin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect control!!!
customer_reviews.text: This leash is perfect! Well made and just the right length! I leave it hanging by the front door. When the door bell rings, I hook my dog up before opening the door. Prevents him from jumping on visitors or bolting out the door into the street!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable grip on leash
customer_reviews.text: I take my 48 lb dog for 3+ mile walks and had to return a different leash because the handle was too hard. This replacement has more cushion for my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Presents Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Delivered on time, and comfortable length and handles.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two leashes and need sturdy ones for a 75 pound and 110 pound German Shepard. Our old leashes had lasted through 5 puppies chewing on them, so it was time for replacements. I like the "give" in the handles, they take the brunt of a sudden pull to chase a squirrel rather than my shoulder. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Kate

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like this more than my other leash because the padding on the inside of the wrist loop is very comfortable against my skin. I would like it more if it had a metal ring near the hand to clip on the poop bag holder, but this is still my favorite leash.
customer_reviews.author: Giant Doofus

customer_reviews.title: Black Lead
customer_reviews.text: Great leash perfect for using my dog coupler so I can walk both my dogs at once. The coupler I bought was so long and I needed a short leash, this is perfect, very easy fort me to hold, the grip is padded nice and it looks very high quality. Great product! I am very happy.
customer_reviews.author: smanioci

product_meta.title: Downtown Pet Supply Strong Durable Dog Leash Lead - Best Big Dog Training Leashes, Heavy Duty Long Nylon Leash
product_meta.description: Size:6 ft x 1 in| Color:BlackThe New Downtown Pet Supply Leash is available in a variety of classic colors and sizes. You will love the easy to grip padded comfort handle and the convenient stainless fastener for quick on and off control. Our leash is incredibly durable woven with Polypropylene to resist water and mildew making this leash your go to for walks in any weather.
feature_bullets: Easy to grip padded handle is comfortable on your hand and makes for enjoyable walks
Black Leash, 6' Foot Length, 1" Inch Width
Made from soft yet durable polypropylene - does not absorb water and is mildew resistant
